factoid: Anna Pávlovna asked what someone thinks of the latest comedy, the coronation at Milan.
Anna Pávlovna asked what someone thinks of the comedy of the people of Genoa and Lucca laying their petitions before Monsieur Buonaparte.
Anna Pávlovna asked what someone thinks of Monsieur Buonaparte sitting on a throne and granting the petitions of the nations.
Anna Pávlovna described the comedy as adorable.
Anna Pávlovna said the comedy is enough to make one’s head whirl.
Anna Pávlovna said the comedy is as if the whole world had gone crazy.
Prince Andrew looked Anna Pávlovna straight in the face with a sarcastic smile.
Prince Andrew remarked that people say he was very fine when he said 'Dieu me la donne, gare à qui la touche!'.
Prince Andrew repeated the words in Italian: 'Dio mi l’ha dato. Guai a chi la tocchi!'.
The phrase 'God has given it to me, let him who touches it beware!' is the translation of 'Dieu me la donne, gare à qui la touche!'.
Anna Pávlovna said she hopes it will prove the last drop that will make the glass run over.
Anna Pávlovna said the glass will run over.
Anna Pávlovna said the sovereigns will not be able to endure this man who is a menace to everything.
The vicomte said he does not speak of Russia when referring to the sovereigns.
The vicomte asked what the sovereigns have done for Louis XVII, for the Queen, or for Madame Elizabeth.
The vicomte said the sovereigns have done nothing for Louis XVII, for the Queen, or for Madame Elizabeth.
The vicomte said they are reaping the reward of their betrayal of the Bourbon cause.
The vicomte said the sovereigns are sending ambassadors to compliment the usurper.
The vicomte sighed disdainfully and changed his position.
Prince Hippolyte had been gazing at the vicomte for some time through his lorgnette.
Prince Hippolyte turned toward the little princess.
Prince Hippolyte asked for a needle.
Prince Hippolyte traced the Condé coat of arms on the table.
Prince Hippolyte explained the Condé coat of arms to the little princess with gravity.
Prince Hippolyte described the Condé coat of arms as 'Bâton de gueules, engrêlé de gueules d’azur—maison Condé'.
The little princess listened and smiled.
The vicomte said that if Buonaparte remains on the throne of France a year longer, things will have gone too far.
The vicomte said that by intrigues, violence, exile, and executions, French society will have been forever destroyed.
The vicomte shrugged his shoulders and spread out his hands.
Pierre wanted to make a remark.
Anna Pávlovna interrupted Pierre.
Anna Pávlovna said that Emperor Alexander has declared that he will leave it to the French people themselves to choose their own form of government.
Anna Pávlovna said she believes that once free from the usurper, the whole nation will throw itself into the arms of its rightful king.
Anna Pávlovna tried to be amiable to the royalist emigrant.
Prince Andrew said that is doubtful.
Prince Andrew said that the vicomte quite rightly supposes that matters have already gone too far.
Prince Andrew said he thinks it will be difficult to return to the old regime.
Pierre said that almost all the aristocracy has already gone over to Bonaparte’s side.
The vicomte replied that it is the Buonapartists who say that.
The vicomte said at the present time it is difficult to know the real state of French public opinion.
Prince Andrew remarked that Bonaparte has said so.
It was evident that Prince Andrew did not like the vicomte and was aiming his remarks at him.
Prince Andrew quoted Napoleon’s words: 'I showed them the path to glory, but they did not follow it'.
Prince Andrew quoted Napoleon’s words: 'I opened my antechambers and they crowded in'.
Prince Andrew said he does not know how far he was justified in saying so.
The vicomte replied that he was not justified at all.
After the murder of the duc, even the most partial ceased to regard him as a hero.
If some people considered him a hero before the murder of the duc, after the murder of the duc there was one martyr more in heaven and one hero less on earth.
